Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Marian Robinson will receive a $160,000 annual pension for life when President Barack Obama leaves office.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of the pension that Marian Robinson will receive.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fabricated news story.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Marian Robinson qualifies for a pension when she has never been a federal employee.
Exist alternative explanation: No evidence of alternative explanation bias.
